review_title: The BEST. Place. I’ve. Worked. Ever.
pros: Very bright and senior coworkers, VERY collaborative office, such friendly staff, some truly amazing leadership! ICs are given trust from leadership to do what they were hired to do. PERIOD.
cons: Product is new, company is young. Some hard work and late nights to get the work done, but it’s a startup, we are working towards something bigger then ourselves
advice_to_mgmt: Keep it up! Honestly! Don’t change a thing, maybe more swag, I got one free sweater and a pair of socks, don’t hoard the swag! ;)

review_title: Building Fintech's next generation of tools
pros:
- Ripple has found the necessary balance between new tech like blockchain and the needs of slow-changing financial institutions

- There's tons of space for new projects and individual initiatives despite already being a relatively large startup

- Direct access to leadership is possible, frank conversation encouraged, and people do not tend to have fragile egos

- This is a truly global organization from the start. With offices and teammates from all over the world, plus a focus on cross-border payments, it will only get more so.
cons: We're doing everything we can to change highly regulated and conservative industry. Much of how things play out with issues like policy and regulation are completely out of Ripple's control. If the thought of that stresses you out, this may not be the place for you!
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the good work! Let's make sure Ripple stays at the forefront of both innovation and reputation in the Fintech and blockchain communities!

review_title: The "Adults in the Room" of Crypto
pros: Excellent on-boarding process that really gets you to meet and learn from everyone, including leadership. Friendly, bright colleagues that are more than happy to collaborate across business units. Modern technology and tool flexibility. Clear vision and plans to change the world.
cons: Some growing pains that would be common at any high-growth company, as systems and processes that were designed for 50 people have trouble scaling to hundreds. Snacks/drinks in SF are so good that the (still pretty good) pantry in NY pales in comparison. Travel policies could be less stingy.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the strong vision, and remember to grow in a smart, people-focused manner.

pros: Seamless recruiting process from start to finish with brilliant people. Very dynamic pace but exciting at the same time as company grows and scales, The culture is that of caring about employees and being very transparent with them. Overall great positivity.
cons: There are really no cons since the company is growing and learning how to adjust and scale along the way but doing it in a way where employees feel like the culture is not shifting and that they are making an impact for which they are being recognized.

review_title: Brilliant and Kind People Doing Important Work
pros: Company has a great, important, and globally relevant mission. Smart people working fast to accomplish A LOT and it's really happening. I'm happy to be in a place where there's a lot of positive energy and momentum.
cons: Steep learning curve in this industry but the company does an amazing job of onboarding to give you all the necessary resources to get up to speed quickly.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the great work of communicating so well with employees and taking good care of them and we will keep working hard to advance our mission.

pros: Ripple's dedication to employee engagement is fantastic. This is a company that really wants you to enjoy working for them. Everyone is very friendly and excited about the company's future. Excellent benefits.
cons: I wish they provided catered meals all the time, lol. But that's just the Silicon Valley in me talking.
advice_to_mgmt: I think there should be a management feedback survey that allows for specific short answer-style comments to be made about managers' style. While it's nice to get a general sense of people's opinions through bullet points, a person who checks "5/5" for "manager is dedicated to getting the job done" might really be saying, "manager micromanages and has a tendency to jump down people's throats if not everything is done exactly to his/her extreme specifications, which were not given at the beginning of the project and are never freely given in general."

pros: Leadership seems to be weathering the volatility in the marketplace with ease, keeping everyone motivated and happy. Closed deals and partnerships are announced almost every day. New hires are joining weekly in offices all around the world. There are multiple events (lunches, speakers, team building, happy hour, etc) every week. It's a very exciting time to be here.
cons: Snack selection could be improved

pros:
good environment
great location
good pays
nice teammates

pros:

- Plenty of documentation to help understand all the products! ie: confluence, videos, training material, power points.. Ripple has its own technical writers so you don't have to worry about keeping up with your documentation. :)

cons: - I'm eating too many chocolate covered pretzels.

pros:
Ripple has one of the most exciting products in Fintech, they’re trying to solve real world problems with real potential of disruption in payments! The vision and strategy of the company is super solid, execution is getting better every day! Leadership team cares for employees as much they care for business and customers. Ripple spends lots of time honing core values and making sure everyone aligned with it! This is a typical growth phase of startup so things change constantly as company tries to find better way of doing things.

Lots of flexibility and decision power if you come with subject matter expertise. Mangers are super supportive of new ideas. Nobody watches when you come or leave , they just focus on getting things done!

Kitchen is always stocked with great snacks, drinks and way more options for coffee than I’ve seen elsewhere. Lunches and breakfasts served few times a month. Coming from a corporate background this is a breath of fresh air!
cons: Not much that I can say
advice_to_mgmt: Hire best and brightest, keep laser focus and stay down to earth!

review_title: A Great Culture Focused on Employees
pros:
Working at Ripple is fast-paced, exciting, and engaging. Ripple is a startup with an audacious goal to enable the Internet of Value, and there is no shortage of work to do. We are led by a fantastic leadership team with. The culture is probably the most important part about the company - all Ripplers believe in the same 5 core values embodied in LEGGO: "Live it, Enjoy it, Get it done, Go for it, Own it".

When I joined Ripple, the people team introduced me to the right people at the company and sent me a surprise gift of champagne and some swag in my first week, definitely making me feel special and appreciated.

Part of the fun of being a blockchain company is the rapidly evolving market landscape, and being held responsible for your own success (or failure) as a company. The risk/reward profile is highly favorable, as Ripple is leading the way (hint: look up "network effects"). And yes, you can elect to get paid in XRP.

There are also snacks in our office micro-kitchens and opportunities to travel around the world to our offices in New York, London, Sydney, India, Singapore and Luxembourg. There are people who are leaders in their field doing the work of their lives sitting right next to you, and it is incredibly rewarding work! Furthermore, Ripple is a company that is constantly in the media, and we are always proud to see positive news (fortunately, there is quite a lot). Internally, the leadership team is incredibly transparent and holds a weekly Q&A for any employees to ask questions.

I would highly recommend working here, as all my experiences have been great.
cons: I see nearly all aspects of working at Ripple as a pro. With so many opportunities to learn and develop your career, it's hard to see any downside to working here.

pros: The board and higher managementt strategy here is on point. Serial enterprenuers who are focussed on building a solid product-market fit.
cons: We're running the risk of creating "silos" adding more top heavy staff to a 300 person startup
advice_to_mgmt: Keep an open mind for new talent and technology

pros: Everyone is very nice and welcoming and are always willing to answer any questions along the way.
cons: No 401K company matching but from what i've been told, this will happen very soon!
advice_to_mgmt: N/A

If you enjoy this part of a company's stage you will love it here! If you would rather be at a fully developed, mature stage company you probably will feel like it's too fast pace for you and you'll need to wear many hats. Personally, I love this stage. review_title: Incredible opportunity to change global banking
pros: Working at Ripple is so empowering because this is the only company that has a real shot at changing how transaction banking works globally. The maturity of the product, roster of clients, government, NGO and regulatory engagement is unparalleled to any other company in this space. The work is extremely impactful - no doubt about it. The people that I work with are some of the smartest, driven and caring people in the world. I am constantly amazed by the resilience of this company in the face of obstacles (and there have been many - what we are doing is not easy). But the leadership team is also very introspective - everyone is open about things that go well as well as things that don't go well. It is an energizing place to work.
cons: Standard growing pains - driving focus, building out processes, saying "no" to things. This is nothing new a startup this size doesn't deal with.

review_title: Very special company in a very special industry. Incredible momentum and great people
pros:
Like another reviewer, I've been at some other top Silicon Valley companies and totally wowed by the talent and passion and Ripple. People are some of the smartest and most respected on the planet, particularly on the Eng side.

I'm working on some of the most interesting challenges of my career in one of the hottest areas in tech right now and many of my peers say the same. The market opportunity is huge and Ripple seems to be ahead of any competitor so it's also great to be at a place that is winning.

The culture is one of the most collaborative I've been at and very inclusive. As a female early in my career, I find it inspiring to see so many women in leadership positions. While some things still need to be figured out, I feel like the various leaders spend a lot of time updating everyone at the company meetings so I know what's going on.

Unlike a lot of early stage startups, the senior leadership team is incredibly experienced. That experience and level of professionalism has reduced the pain points, lack of direction and general frustrations that I've experienced at other startups with young leaders who are learning how to lead or manage for the very first time.

I've also enjoyed the various company and team outings and I've made a lot of good friends here!

As other people have said, Ripple is a great place to be if you want to be the best at your game and work with world-class talent. Managers are very understanding about time off and personal commitments, but people are also super motivated about Ripple's mission and want to continue the amazing momentum so expectations are high to deliver great work product. Generally people who aren't motivated to win and can't adapt to the pace and expectations around high quality work product don't last too long.
cons:
Definitely some growing pains like any startup. Some teams are more execution oriented than others and the rest of the company can feel it when someone isn't pulling their weight.

Some teams need people with more experience in their specific role. Feels like the company is growing so quickly that it is outgrowing the skill set of some of the earlier or more junior hires.

It's super fast paced and the expectations are high. It''s motivating for me and I'm still able to maintain a decent work-life balance but it may not be a fit for everyone.
advice_to_mgmt:
Continue to hire - we need more people!

We are at the point where we need more processes as the company grows in more locations. We are scaling too quickly to not have streamlined communication or somewhere to reference on who to contact for various things or to get approvals or decisions made.

Continue to focus. The market opportunity is so big and there are so many things we can pursue that I think we need to stay focused or there is risk of burn out.

The company outings, the culture committees and various activities are really well done - keep them up!

review_title: Great Place to Learn and Grow
pros: Intelligent and driven team, opportunities to learn are endless, friendly and kind people
cons: The company is growing very quickly and sometimes there aren't enough hands on deck to keep up.

pros: I've been working in tech for 10 years and Ripple is the real deal. Most recently I was at another hot company in silicon valley and the contrast here is profound. Ripple has a a very open environment of smart people without the arrogance that permeates other companies that are growing quickly - addressing big markets. I attribute a big part of that to mature, experienced leadership that has a clear plan and is executing that plan.
cons: To be fair, Ripple is not immune from growing pains... that's what happens when you add about 25% of your total headcount in one quarter! There are some mid-level managers (and even one or two more senior managers) that need to scale with the business and focus more on helping their teams grow with the company.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep the very regular pro-active communication going - and encourage all managers to communicate more regularly with their teams.

pros:

pros:

review_title: Interesting start up with a terrible culture
pros: Almost all of the employees are super friendly and fun to work with. They also have a convenient location a few blocks from the Montgomery station.
cons: The executive team is completely disconnected from the rest of the employee base. The direction the company is heading remains unclear even though they try to explain it during the Bi-weekly company updates. Communication is extremely poor between the upper management and the rest of the company. The CEO seems nice but you're taught to avoid talking to him most of the time because he has a tendency to flip out over nothing, and once you're on his list it's impossible to get out. The company culture seems great on the surface, but once your'e in you realize they don't operate under the values they created. When things don't go the way management expects it to be prepared to take full blame for the entire project, even if you provided clear written feedback about said project.
advice_to_mgmt: Provide clear direction and communicate decisions to your employees.

Without a doubt, Ripple is a great place to grow and I would recommend checking out the company's mission and applying if interested. The screening process is well organized and fun (compared to the typical interview process) and it's a joy to work with the recruiters here.

Ripple's internship program has been amazing and I look forward to seeing it blossom and bring more talent to the team. I am already considering coming back!
cons: When there aren't enough raspberries in the fridge

pros: The company has great perks, free lunches, gym membership.

pros: There are some incredibly talented people, product could be a game-changer, and there are a lot of benefits/perks.
cons: Product direction is a mess and use cases are not resonating with potential customers. There is no awareness on how each department interacts with each other to get to a common goal. Until recently, there was no HR leader in place so attrition is a concern and internal communication around these issues is generally poor. There are "leaders" here that should not be leaders. Work demands leave most people working 10+ hour days every day, which is not only unsustainable but unfair given a lot of people's compensation. If you're considering working here, make sure you can deal with constantly changing direction and start-up hours/effort with the hierarchy and top-down philosophy of corporate culture.
advice_to_mgmt: Pick a product direction. Don't be afraid to hire better. Find people that care and support them.

review_title: Smart People, Cutting Edge, Some Missteps
pros: Very cutting edge technology with serious potential to change the world, hopefully for the better. Lots of really smart coworkers and a mostly positive company culture. Fairly accommodating to remote employees.
cons: The company is still trying to regain its focus and direction after a major pivot, that leaves some question as to whether some products are legacy or not. The efforts to "collaborate" with regulators frequently turn to what appears to be living in dread of attracting regulatory attention. Certain managers are bad at taking criticism and have an immature, adversarial mentality.
advice_to_mgmt: Let's revisit our company values. We used to value humility and openness. Now I'm not so sure.

pros:
I love working at Ripple. The team is incredibly ambitious. Amazing work culture. People are friendly, supportive and helpful. The CEO and COO are a dynamic duo. I feel lucky to be surrounded by so many inspiration and intelligent people.

Determination, out-of-the-box thinking, adaptability, and teamwork.

I love that our culture is so open. No one is afraid to ask questions. Everyone is approachable. Definitely the best job I've ever had.
cons: There are none. Period.
advice_to_mgmt: shoot for the moon.

pros: Smart team, great technology provided to employees, perfect location.
cons: Everyone is burning out. 12-14 hour days are expected and not sustainable.
advice_to_mgmt: You need to respect that people have lives outside of work.

pros:
Ripple is a company with an interesting mission and vision. Blockchain is one of the hottest topics in finance, and Ripple has the clear head start in the enterprise space. Unlike many fintech startups, Ripple has real partnerships with banks. It's the CEO's third fintech startup, and it helps to have that experience to draw on.

There are some extremely smart and talented people, especially on the engineering team.
cons:
Serious growing pains. Used to be a fun place to work with happy hours, culture committee events, and occasional outings. After hiring a COO from the corporate world, Ripple decided the only path forward is hard-work and cut nearly all investment in employee happiness. So no more happy hours or clubs. You'll typically find people in the office well past 7pm pretending to work. No company lunch, so you probably won't ever get to know your fellow employees outside of work mode. Unsurprisingly, this leads to a lot of conflict between teams.

And don't expect your voice to be heard - senior management is basically a bunch of early 30s, first time managers who don't understand how to lead teams and therefore put an axe on all feedback. The C-levels insist that they're too important to talk to directly, even though Ripple is only 120 employees. Corporate culture.
advice_to_mgmt: Rethink Ripple's core values to decide what's important. Find a real product-market fit. Invest in employees to stop serious burnout issues. Consider hiring C-levels over the younger leadership team members to provide a clear, consistent direction. Be proactive, not reactive.

review_title: Ripple is an amazing place to work
pros: People are open minded, smart, and there are not a lot of egos to contend with. The work is rewarding, and the teamwork is a huge plus. I love my job!
cons: I honestly have no complaints. I was talking to a friend who I used to work with about all the great things about Ripple and had to stop myself because I could tell he was getting jealous. :)
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you are already doing.

pros:

-A lot of opportunity to try new technologies, learn new languages, wear many different hats

It's also a company where the future is being invented, in a sense, in that the field itself is being shaped by the people who work here. Working at Ripple Labs gives you an unusual amount of influence over the organization within the space, which is valuable enough to form a kind of compensation in itself.
cons: Any company that is increasing in size so rapidly will have some growing pains, but so far these have been managed well.
advice_to_mgmt: The thoughtfulness that you've shown with regard to the office, equity, etc. has been noticed & is sincerely appreciated.

pros:
Ripple Labs was designed to be a place of constant innovation and learning, and that clearly carries through to the day-to-day environment. The entire team is smart, helpful, and passionate about their jobs. Everyone is extremely willing to help new employees learn, and there are weekly lunch and learn meetings to foster better understanding of cross-team topics. I knew as soon as I walked into my interview that this was absolutely the place for me.

It's an awesome time to be working at Ripple Labs, as we're growing rapidly and witnessing new, exciting developments everyday. It feels amazing to be part of building a product that is on the brink of transforming the finance industry. For people who are motivated by plugging into a larger vision, this is an environment where you really have a chance to shape the future.
cons: Ripple is admittedly a complex technology for those of us who haven't come from a financial or cryptography background, so it takes patience and time to get up to speed. This is offset by the ample opportunities for learning. We're also in rapid growth stage which always comes with some minor growing pains, but the leadership team is well aware of the challenges and experienced in making the growth period as smooth as possible.
advice_to_mgmt: The leadership team has done a great job of maintaining an open, constructive environment in the past, where everyone feels in the loop on the latest updates and able to provide input on company decisions. Let's make sure this continues as we add new team members and continue to foster a friendly, family-like environment.

pros:

The development team is passionate about open source software.
Management is continually exploring new benefit opportunities for employees.
The office in downtown San Francisco is top notch.

review_title: Opportunity of a lifetime to change finance
pros:

- Vision I believe in - If we realize our vision, Ripple will democratize payments, opening access to financial systems to people around the world who have been shut out to date.
cons: I can't think of any cons right now.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep us laser-focused executing against the strategy. It's our time to seize the opportunity at hand!

pros:
When you first understand what Ripple does you think "wow, that's crazy" -- enable people to send money anywhere in the world, in any currency, in 5 seconds, practically for free. Then you start asking how it works and you think "wow, that's REALLY crazy" -- it's a distributed network that's open source and open for anyone to join and use. Then, you ask about how the company makes money if it's all open source and you find that it's a startup that actually makes money.

Ripple Labs has an unbelievably talented and intelligent team. I have met some of the smartest people I know here, but they are also the type to take the time to explain (in whatever level of technical details you want) exactly what they're working on, what it does, and how it works. I am truly inspired by the people I work with.

People work hard here because they believe the company and the technology have great potential and they are passionate about and challenged by what they do. At the same time, it's not the kind of place where you're expected to work crazy hours -- the CEO has a family and kids and so he's going to go home at a reasonable time and that kind of attitude definitely trickles down from him. There are some people who are out by 6pm most days and others who work consistently over the weekends because this is what they love doing. There's a great balance and overall it's a fantastic place to work.

Lastly, there were about 5 days in the past year when I was not excited to go to work, and those were largely because I didn't get enough sleep the night before. It's really an inspiring team and I've had an opportunity to work on some fascinating and challenging projects.
cons: This is a startup that's growing fast. The team has grown by 4 or 5 times in the past year and we're constantly hiring more. As such, we haven't gotten all the processes right yet and it's important that new employees seek out the help, explanations, or guidance they need. Individual teams are still quite small but it's definitely getting to the point where not everyone knows one another.
advice_to_mgmt: Really my only gripe is that over the past couple of months we've gone from emphasizing how flat the organization is to hearing constant mentions of the Leadership Team's strategy offsite meetings. As the company grows it obviously becomes impossible for everyone to participate in strategy conversations. However, I think the leadership and strategy of the company could be more open and inclusive if we thought about it first as a collaborative process that not everyone has the time or bandwidth to participate in (though they could if they wanted to), and less as the domain of the "Leadership Team" whose findings then get shared with the rest of the company.

review_title: The best place I have worked.
pros: Far and away, my favorite part of working at Ripple Labs is the people. It's amazing that we have kept up such a high bar in terms of talent as well as culture. The company has changed significantly as it has grown since I have joined, but the values that Ripple Labs and my coworkers hold dear have kept us moving together in a collaborative and challenging environment.
cons: It is sometimes really stressful. Not in the sense that there is a lot of unnecessary pressure, but in the sense that each and every person here is very good at what they do, and there's the expectation that you always turn in great work.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep on doing what you're doing. I haven't had any reason to doubt the commitment to the employees or to the Ripple community.

pros:
The business has a cool and unusual opportunity to help and enhance - not compete with - market incumbents.

The company is full of civic-minded, deeply thoughtful people who are concerned with maximizing financial inclusion in the world by lowering costs for everyone. This is contrary to some misconceptions about the company's intentions and values. I am a huge fan of my colleagues.

Culture of merit and transparency. Good ideas make their way around the company very quickly. Chris (CEO) does an awesome job of cultivating this attitude.

There is an exciting sense of uncertainty about what the future holds for the technology. After 6 months of beginning a new initiative addressing a specific industry, we are already cooperating with some of the largest players in the space.
cons: As the business evolves, the company is experiencing growing pains. For example, sometimes it seems like some groups are catching up to others in working toward a set of goals, which are rapidly changing. That said, not unusual for a young company, and not difficult to solve.
advice_to_mgmt: Ensure that you continue to foster a cohesive company by hiring and retaining positive people, and identifying and addressing people who aren't happy with their work or colleagues. Hiring jerks is a risk for any company.

review_title: Amazing culture & people; brilliant technology & product
pros: I've worked at a number of startups and Ripple Labs is by far the most exciting company I have ever worked at. My colleagues are exceptionally bright, down to earth, passionate, and helpful. Not only has the company has gone to great lengths in managing to recruit top talent, they have ensured that hiring people who are genuinely kind, with a team player mindset, and most of all, humility. Ripple also has a very strong engineering culture.
cons: While the company is going through its natural startup growth pains, management has recently hired some folks across Finance, HR, and administrative support to bring more organization and structure into place. While progress is being made, we are desperately needing more office space so we can have better communications between teams. Management has said that we are a few weeks away from the move, and once that happens, things are going to be even more awesome!
advice_to_mgmt: We already do a great job of being open and transparent, but I just hope that we maintain this as we get bigger as a company.

pros: Ripple Labs is working on a payment layer that could have profound impact globally. It's exciting to be a part of this supportive team, facing new challenges everyday. The culture here is great, and the team is very talented coming from diverse backgrounds. The company is very flexible with time-off policies and understands work-life balance. Overall, definitely a great place to work.
cons: As Ripple Labs continues to grow rapidly, it's running into some typical startup growth pains such as lack of office space and implementing a more stable operational structure at a company level. Fortunately, the company is moving quickly to address these concerns and other issues that may come up.

pros: The team is incredibly talented yet the culture is warm and humble. Cultures/values are excellent.

That means that mistakes are inevitably made and short term strategies are constantly being re-assessed and honed. This can be a daunting and sometimes frustrating process. It's not for everyone, but if you can handle the uncertainty, it makes for an exciting ride.
advice_to_mgmt: Better communication and organization about granular developments between teams. Generally, management is great.
